The Thanegraves, located in western Wintercrux in Irrisen, are the final resting place of the Djurstor Confederacy thanes. Two boreal ogre tribes claim the hilly stretch, which is dotted with burial mounds and tombs and largely forgotten by the area's Ulfen folk.

Thanesrest Mausoleum, on the island of Orthost in the Linnorm Kingdom of Broken Bay, is a Thassilonian building that was turned into a mausoleum for kings of Broken Bay. This practice was halted after the body of King Kernic Quicktongue rose up during his funeral, after being possessed of a demon, to murder then create undead of all the mourners.

It is the greatest mausoleum on the isle and was not originally built to inter the dead. The elaborate mausoleum may have originally served as a Thassilonian castle or prison. Its chambers below extend for many miles deep under Orthost.

The Conservatory is a secret, Jalmeri training school for spies located on the inaccessible island of Grand Sarret in the Obari Ocean.

Housed in a collection of buildings that once served to house the harem of the legendary Maharajah Khiben-Sald, the Conservatory trains students in the arts of seduction, cooking, music, and the careful manipulation and influence of governments around the world. Once they complete their training, the graduates are sent to courts, noble houses, and seats of power throughout the Inner Sea region in order to further the ambitions and interests of the government of Jalmeray. They report back to the Conservatory on a regular basis, where their information is catalogued in an extensive, ever-growing library on the island, one of the greatest repositories of secret knowledge throughout the Inner Sea region.

The Old Light is the most visible landmark of the western Varisian town of Sandpoint. It is believed to have been a lighthouse during the ancient Thassilonian empire, though much of the structure has crumbled over the ages.
The Pit is an infamous Darklands-like area in the Devil's Platter southeast of Sandpoint.

The Uskheart is the central redoubt of the infamous Nidalese circle of druids called the Shades of the Uskwood. Located in the southern Uskwood, the Shades have recently uncovered a disturbing life form known as the hive. These creatures consume and transform everything they encounter, and they seem to be outside the natural order of Golarion. Despite their uniqueness, they are not extraplanar or supernatural in origin and refer to themselves by an unpronounceable Aklo word.
The island of Thistletop is located in the Varisian Gulf off the coast of the Nettlewood.

The semi-permanent hideout, known as the Thorn River bandit camp lies roughly 60 feet from the Thorn River in the Narlmarches. It is set up on both sides of a narrow, meandering creek and a forest trail that runs beside it. The camp is inhabited by eleven bandits, who are responsible for raiding Oleg's Trading Post in the name of the Stag Lord.
Thorn's End is a hidden fortress of the Winter Council in the demon-infested Tanglebriar of Kyonin.
Thorngate is a disabled elf gate near Tanglebriar in Kyonin. It was deactivated to prevent demons from corrupting it upon Treerazer's arrival and has remained inactive since then.
Thousand Relics Pass is a mountain pass through the northern World's Edge Mountains of Taldor. It is bordered to the west by the Falling River and to the east by Aroden's Eye.

The Thrashing Badger was a rough-and-ready bar in the Yolubilis Harbor district of Kintargo that burned to the ground during the Night of Ashes. Before its destruction, The Thrashing Badger was home not just to rowdy sailors and labourers but also served as a drinking hole for a myriad of malcontents and rebels, most of whom now drink at nearby Clenchjaw's instead.

As of 4724 AR, many attempts to rebuild the tavern have variously failed.

Thraxnorni, also known as the "Bone Caverns" are a series of caverns that sprawl beneath Iobaria's Fangard Forest. A cairn located a short distance away from a crossroad of the Koloran Roads within the forest marks the entrance to the caverns, though other sinkholes that lead to their dark depths are thought to exist. The caverns get their name from stories that say they are lined from floor to ceiling with bones, the victims of the undead and other menaces that dwell within.

The Three Stars are a set of three pyramids in southeastern Katapesh, within 20 miles of the Katapeshi coastline and Obari Ocean. The pyramids are made of yellow stone and topped with a large shining crystal that supposedly repairs itself if damaged.

Each pyramid is only 12 feet tall, small when compared with Katapeshi sites like the Red Pyramid or the Glass Pyramids and tiny when compared with Osirion's vast structures. There are no known entrances to the pyramids, and they are subject to the usual rumors suggesting that the pyramids hide either a dragon's horde, a dead king's treasure, or undead genies.

One of the more unusual and most prominent rumors is that the pyramids hide the remains of some sort of benevolent being described as either beings of living flame, beautiful maidens, or feathered serpents (possibly describing a muse azata) who sleeps beneath the pyramids.

The rumours also suggest that one day the sleepers will awaken. One such story claims that this will happen when Golarion becomes too chaotic, while according to another rumor there is a fourth pyramid that can be used to awaken the sleepers.

The Three-Legged Devil is a dance hall located in the Jarvis End district of Kintargo. Dance halls in Kintargo combine the functions of a musical venue, tavern, and brothel. The Three-Legged Devil is neither the largest nor busiest such dance hall, but it is Kintargo's oldest, and also notable for the its bardic owner Giveni Henge, who previously allowed it to be used as a safe haven for rebels and fugitives.
Threshold was a prison tower in the High Cairns of Sarkoris reserved for those who practiced arcane magic. It became the epicenter of the Worldwound upon its opening in 4606 AR.

The Throne of the Troll King is a huge stone chair atop a high hill near the Kodar Mountains, which is located in the Southmoor region of the Lands of the Linnorm Kings. Legends claim that by sitting on the throne overnight at midwinter, one could gain dominion over all of Southmoor's trolls until the following midwinter's eve. Consequently, dozens of troll tribes guard the area around the throne to ensure that nobody attempts to prove the legend true.

Thrylheim is the ruined city of the frost giant nation that once controlled much of the Fog Peaks. It was destroyed in a devastating war with the white dragons of the mountains and is now largely in ruin. Underground portions of the city are still said to exist, and hold the frost giant sword Eldavar, used by the last konig of Thrylhim, Virtosk, to kill the elder white dragon Keljanir.
The volcano Thunderblood Peak, formally known as "Thisskarshai", is the tallest mountain in the Chenlun Mountains. It gets its name from the frequent earthquakes that occur around it.

The fortress of Thunderhold on the isle of Flintyreach in the Lands of the Linnorm Kings, is ruled by the charismatic hill giant chieftain Gorgnak who leads a semi-loyal band of hill giant, ettin, and troll warriors. The giants who live in the mountains of the island's interior are the greatest threat to the dromaar community of Averaka. The Averaka giant slayers have dedicated themselves to the eradication of their monstrous neighbors.

The Thunderscale Warrens are a large network of caves on Mediogalti Island, located less than a day's journey inland of the pirate city of Ilizmagorti. The warrens are home to the Thunderscale tribe, the largest of the island's tribes of kobolds. Numerous rumours about the caves make various claims; some suggest they are a source of gemstone or gold deposits, whilst others suspect they lead deep into the earth and perhaps link to the Darklands.
Thyellados is a mountainous island in Iblydos near Xaktilos known for the enormous mountain called the Pinnacles of Winds.

Tidewater Rock is a fortified tower over 70 feet tall built on the rocky shore of Windward Isle. It is made of sturdy masonry walls atop a 10-foot-high stone base, filled with packed dirt. A stone stair rises to the heavy front door. Tidewater Rock sits right on the lagoon's edge and commands a good view of almost the entire island. At high tide, the water rises almost to the height of its stone base. The current owner of the Rock is Agasta Smythee, widow of the pirate Iron Bert Smythee.

The Tiger's Eye Monastery is a remote building located in the northern forests of Jalmeray, far from local trade routes. It is said to be decorated with depictions of tiger-headed humanoids and currently is occupied by a group of bandits.
Little is known about Tilxar, a location in northeastern Geb near the Ydrion River.

Tok-Tshka, also known as the Evernest, is a bog strider gathering place in the depths of the Verduran Forest about a day-and-a-half's travel from Bellis. It is not quite a community but is, instead, a place for the solitary creatures to assemble. Surrounded by hills, Tok-Tshka consists of a small, nameless lake with a trio of islands sat in the middle of it. The islands are linked by woven marsh grass and their tree canopies. At the heart of the largest island sits a grove of evergreen trees surrounding a small pond with a boulder at its centre where the bog striders convene meetings with outsiders. Tok-Tshka is led by a seer-queen known as Rik'Visk.
Tolsen Peak is a mountain in the southwestern Menador Mountains of Cheliax east of Hellmouth Gulf.

The Tomb of Emperors is a ruin of the ancient Jistka Imperium located in what is today the nation of Rahadoum. It is situated in the eastern desert, beyond the Uta River, and is a destination for the Pathfinders of Swordmeet Lodge in Manaket.

The Tomb of Emperors was a sprawling, colonnaded structure built at the Oasis of Xerapsion and it is known to have housed treasures made by famous Jistkan artisans. The Tomb was originally dedicated to the fifth ruler of Jistka Imperium, Inperantike Eraliskos, after her death at a decisive battle at Xeraspion—a battle that expanded the Imperium to the region east of the Uta. The nomadic tribes of the area became so impressed by the monument that a lot of nomads joined the Imperium army, forming an entire legion. Ancient Osirian invaders and their div allies looted the surface of the structure and most of its offering chambers during the era of the Night Plague but the Tekritani refused to further pillage the Tomb, leaving its lower levels and catacombs untouched.

The Tomb of Statues is the burial place of Pharaoh An-Hepsu III's family and servants, located on the western banks of Osirion's River Sphinx north of the city of An. Unlike in similar tombs, where the family and retainers of a pharaoh were buried alive or put to death following the monarch's passing, An-Hepsu III took advantage of his medusa consort's power, and had them all turned to stone.

The Tomb of the Bound Sphinx is a pyramid shaped tomb constructed in the Barrier Wall mountains. It was constructed in -1116 AR by Pharaoh Kenaton to be his final resting place, but weas unknowingly built over an underground chamber into which it collapsed a few decades after construction. This destroyed some of the treasure it contained and shifted some of its passages, making exploration difficult.

As well as the final resting place for Kenaton, the tomb also contains a magical prison which contains Hephtethnet the Reaver, a hieracosphinx who terrorized Osirion during Kenaton's life.

The Tomb of the Iron Medusa is the underground final resting place of House Adella, a noble house of Taldor that once was among the empire's most wealthy and extravagant houses. They descended into diabolism and depravity, and the house was dissolved within the span of a single generation during the 43rd century AR.

The Tomb of the Thousand Tusks is a crypt located in the southernmost Barrier Wall mountains on the border between the Mwangi Expanse and the Sodden Lands. It is believed to be the lair of the adhukait asura Kaisadvaisad, who guards the skull of the empyreal lord Shei Five Dawns.
The Tooth and Nail is a quiet tavern located on Tuce Alley in the Old Kintargo district of Kintargo. As of 4724 AR, it was run by Setrona Sabinus.
The Torch Orchard is a stunning and very exclusive orchard. It is also secretly a meeting place for followers of Mephistopheles.

Tower Valballus is one of only two truly defensible positions on the Bleakwall in the Ustalavic province of Canterwall on the border with the Hold of Belkzen. It is avoided by both the militia of Canterwall and the orcs of Belkzen, as it is known to be the haunt of dangerous creatures.

Located in the southwestern plains of Nidal, the Tower of Slant Shadows is a rugged iron edifice that juts diagonally from the umber grassland. It is believed that it sinks several times its own height into the earth beneath it. A mystery to most, the tower is in fact one of the almost-forgotten Star Towers, constructed untold millennia ago by Zon-Kuthon (then Dou-Bral) as part of the process necessary to confine Rovagug within Golarion.
The Tower of Winds is a strange structure located on a peninsula on the Plains of Paresh in northwestern Qadira near the Inner Sea's Saray Coast.

The Trackless Storm is an endless stretch of sandstorm in southern Katapesh near the border with Nex. The trackless storm rages year-round regardless of the surrounding weather conditions, although the severity of the storm varies. Sometimes the Trackless Storm is little more than a mild dust cloud, while other times it blows strong enough to scour flesh from bone. The landscape within the storm constantly changes as the winds alter the sand dunes.

Numerous rumours and legends are connected with the Trackless Storm. Some claim that a field of hardy, untouched pesh lies at the heart of the storm, while others claim that the Stone Sorcerer's legendary Sanctum of Sand resides within a valley hidden inside its swirling winds.

The estate of Treaclerun is home to the ruler of Kazuhn Prefecture, the Grand Duchess Mellea Denzarni, and is named for the decadent parties her ancestors used to throw there: parties where fountains of honey flowed like water. While appearing as little more than a hedonistic hunting lodge to escape from the strife of Taldan politics, in reality, Treaclerun has a bloody history. Serving as the breadbasket of Taldor's capital, Oppara, rulership of Kazuhn has generally fallen to only the most ruthless of Taldor's power players. The estate serves as a discrete location for shady deeds and sinister schemes. Almost every noble estate in Taldor boasts a handful of ghost stories associated with it, Treaclerun is a rare exception: no lingering spectres haunt its ground. Rumour has it this is due to some strange but deliberate quirk of the estate's design.

The Tree of the Thousand Eyes is a colossal tree located in the south of the Jolizpan Forest in Xopatl. The tree is named for the many patterns covering it that closely resemble the eyes of a peacock's tail.

Those who live nearby believe that the Tree of the Thousand Eyes grew from the heart of the chicome coatl that died when a fragment of the Aeon Star struck it. This legendary event occurred thousands of years ago during the formation of the Jolizpan Forest. According to local legend, the heart of the chicome coatl still exists at the centre of the Tree of the Thousand Eyes and, if someone could make this heart beat again, it would resurrect the powerful coatl.

The Trilmsgitt Towers in Molthune are three towers, each within several miles of the others. They were built by three brothers, each of whom was a wizard, and are believed to be connected to each other by magic. However, nothing has been heard from any of the brothers for some time, and the towers appear to have been abandoned for some unknown reason.

The Triodea is by far the most important playhouse and concert hall in the whole of Magnimar, and possibly all of western Varisia. It sits in the Summit region in Magnimar's Naos district, and its entrance is located on Starsilver Plaza. The venue is owned by Durstin Versade; although the aiuvarin counter-tenor and dancer Kassiel Iylmrain is the one who makes all the important decisions.

Tumen was once Osirion's largest city and briefly its capital. Located 75 miles from Sothis in the eastern Underdunes far from the River Sphinx, the city relied upon pure water drawn forth "by the grace of the Opaline Satrap whom the Radiant Pharaoh had favored, and in turn was favored by", which contemporary Osirionologists speculate, referred to a massive aquifer or portal to the elemental planes. The city's water supply began to ebb shortly before the deaths of the Four Pharaohs of Ascension, and the city descended to abandonment and an endless cycle of burial in the khamsin sandstorms.

Despite its remote location, the city remains a popular destination for scholars and treasure hunters.

Tuskgutter's lair is home to Tuskgutter, the most notorious boar in the Greenbelt. This irritable beast, well known by local hunters for his characteristic gray face bristles, resides in a pit concealed by the branches of a large fallen pine tree. The lair is littered with the bones of Tuskgutter's prey.

Uddo was the capital of the Teikoku Shogunate in what is now known as Minkai. It was conquered and razed by the armies of Kuga Setsuna during the Battle of Eight Bridges in 6116 IC; Minkai was founded three years later, with the downriver port city of Kasai as its capital.
The Uldani Necropolis is a site in the desert interior of Thuvia. It lies not far from the city of Pashow.

Ulduvai was the last of the Shory flying cities in Garund and the Inner Sea region. In a misguided effort to restore the Shory Empire, the sorcerers of Ulduvai consorted with the powers of the Dark Tapestry, which ended up with the entire population being driven mad by a shoggoth servant of Azathoth. The city crashed upon Mirrshock Glacier in the southeastern Mwangi Expanse, south of Mount Dowama in the Shattered Range in -507 AR.

Three ancient Shory sorcerers survived to the present, albeit as undead creatures: Yakmar, the insane adventurer-mage; Yithdul, the arcane diplomat; and Banderak, former head of the city's aeromantic corps.

The central city of Undarin in Sarkoris is located on the Sarkora River at its confluence with the dry bed of the Rolling River, and was once a center for the selling of livestock and ore in the kingdom of Sarkoris. Once the city was overrun by demons after the opening of the Worldwound in 4606 AR, its stockyards and animal pens were used to temporarily control the human population before being sent off for further processing. Like most of the cities in the region, the holy warriors of the Fifth Mendevian Crusade deemed Undarin to be too corrupted to be rebuilt, and instead razed the city in 4718 AR.

Undervale is a way station in the Umbral Basin that also serves as a safe haven for the Bellflower Network. The area is teeming with predators and potential trouble, but it also offers an opportunity for those seeking to escape Cheliax or Nidal. Constructs and illusions protect the station, and part of it is built underground. Its residents are mostly halflings whose cheerful and welcoming nature is a warm welcome.

The leader of Undervale is undoubtedly Landry Tethertine, who maintains the constructs and seeks new members to join the station.

Located in the Arcadian Ocean west of Acisazi and northwest of the Dismal Nitch, the entrance to the underwater cave known as Urchin's Maw gapes from the side of the continental shelf, overlooking a precipitous drop into the inky depths below. It earns its name from the riot of sizable deep sea urchins that dwell on the rock face surrounding the cave entrance.

Urfa-Halij is an ancient memorial located in the Sophra Prefecture and is sacred to both the people of Taldor and their neighbouring rivals in Qadira. Urfa-Halij marks the location of the first ever battle between the people of Taldor and, as it was at the time, the Empire of Kelesh. Known as the Battle of Urfa to the Taldans and the Battle of Halij to the Qadirans, Urfa-Halij recognises both perspectives and stands as a testament of respect for those soldiers lost by both sides of the war. Both sides recognise this place as sacred and, by custom, no sort of conflict takes place for miles around the monument. This has made it one of the most peaceful and fertile areas along the war-ravaged border between Taldor and Qadira, with rabbits being particularly common.

The Urfa-Halij monument itself consists of two raised arms, one wielding a Taldan-styled longsword, the other a Qadiran scimitar, the blades of both meeting in the middle where a huge diamond is set. This diamond catches even the dimmest of light, making it seem as if the blades are sparking even on a moonlit night. Many debate, due to the striking nature of Urfa-Halij, if it is really a monument to the dead or if, in fact, it is secretly a tribute to the glory of war.

The Usher's Hall is one of the most important buildings in the city of Magnimar as it is home to the Council of Ushers, which is one of Magnimar's ruling bodies. Located in the Capital District, the governmental hub of Magnimar, the Usher's Hall sits opposite the famous Indros cul Vydrarch monument at the centre of the district.

The Usher's Hall is an impressive building, covered with ornate sculptures (as befitting such an important building in the City of Monuments). The building contains enough space to house all 117 members of the Council of Ushers.

The Vaishau Ruin is the grey, scorched remains of an old fortress located in the foothills of the Hungry Mountains of Lastwall, just a stone's throw from the Ustalavic county of Virlych. The ruin stands on the banks of the Mesmos River, which cuts the main pass through the mountains and connects Vigil with Gallowspire.

Valas's Gift was a small town in the north of the nation of Mendev, located on the road north from Kenabres. Although it was populated as of 4711 AR, the town was nothing more than overgrown ruins by 4725 AR, and all that remained were bubbling springs of blood-red water said to be the fertilizing blessing of Valas, a holy man.
Kaleb Valdemar, son of the late Ethram Valdemar and head of House Valdemar, runs Valdemar Villa in Magnimar when not visiting Sandpoint.

The Vale of Green Spears is a forest of massive bamboo plants the size of redwood trees, planted 1,000 years ago according to legends by a wizard challenged by Tian Shen] to plant 100 million trees. The reasons for the challenge vary by the legend's telling and include a test of the wizard's abilities and an attempt to house displaced birds.

Harvesting the sought-after bamboo risks becoming the prey of the progeny of the late forest dragon Genseirin, who laired here and had long protected the old-growth stalks at the forest's center.

The Vale of Shadows is a dangerous valley located in the Five Kings Mountains, in which one of Zon-Kuthon's Star Towers is located. Here the planar fabric between the Netherworld and Golarion is weak, and the Vale all but appears to be within the Netherworld itself, and creatures and monsters from that plane live within. The elves of Elistia forbid entrance to the Vale of Shadows, believing nothing good comes from it and knowing who venture inside return alive.

The Valley of Shards is a long shallow valley near the headwaters of the Asp River in Osirion. The valley's floor is full of shards of more than a thousand pots. The shards are inscribed with Ancient Osiriani hieroglyphs which seem to deal with magic, both divine and arcane. A small group of hermits study the shards, attempting to piece them together into a coherent message. The kholo roaming the region either have not noticed the hermits or have left them unharmed on purpose.

Nel-Shevotha is an isolated, reclusive settlement in the foothills of the World's Edge Mountains, inhabited by the undead remains of colonists of the ancient Azlanti Empire who died during Earthfall. The name "Nel-Shevotha" has been lost to history, and in modern Golarion the region is called the Valley of the Azlanti or Valley of the Azlant.

The Valley of the Birthing Death is located in the foothills of the Stormspear Mountains in the far north-east of Icemark in the Lands of the Linnorm Kings. The valley looks as if it had been hewed clean out of the mountain and its narrow red walls create a realm of perpetual twilight. The Varki tribes avoid the valley due to the curse of Birthing Death: a curse manifesting as a rapid rejuvenation of the afflicted taking them back to childhood and then oblivion. This curse is not just physical but mental as well; stealing the memories and experience of the victim as they regress. Many have attempted to study or harness this strange effect but they have all succumbed to it, the knowledge required to understand the strange curse is inevitably one of the first things the curse claims.

The Valley of the Chosen Children is a canyon of the Naurepzi River in Xopatl after it flows away from the Follower's River. Locals claim that at night the laughter of dozens of children echoes through the valley, and that anyone who sails the entire length of the Valley of the Chosen Children in a single night receives some kind of blessing.

The Valley of the Pyramids, uncovered during a recent khamsin storm, is an unusual landscape of twisted, sand-carved canyons not fully seen since the time of the Four Pharaohs of Ascension. Rumors hold that the four pyramids contain magical portals that allow access to the extradimensional tombs of the Four Pharaohs. As of 4708 AR, artifacts from the tombs had already begun appearing in Sothis's bazaars.

The cathedral-like, Ustalavic fortress of Valorforge at the Gap of Valballus in the Hold of Belkzen was one of the fortresses of the defensive barrier of Sunwall. When the Sunwall fell in 4237 AR the veteran soldiers of Lastwall retreated to a second line of defense but the Ustalavs of Valorforge didn't abandon their fortress in the face of invincible orc hordes and all within were slaughtered. Now known as Valorfoe, the abandoned castle is shunned by the orcs due to the shadowy terrors that lurk within.
Vanderale Villa is the home of Magnimar's House Vanderale, one of the city's oldest families.

Vaneo Arvanxi was a vast estate in the Rego Sacero of Westcrown that as of 4709 AR served as the home of Lord-Mayor Aberian Arvanxi, into which he had poured such immense wealth that it had earned the local nickname of Aberian's Folly.

The Vangeline Pass in the Shattered Range provides entrance into a remote portion of western Geb from the eastern Mwangi Expanse. It is one of the three major passes from the Mwangi Expanse to the east: Kho-Rarne Pass, the Ndele Gap, and the Vangeline Pass. The pass is rarely used because there no major cities in the eastern Mwangi Expanse close to the Vangeline Pass and also the usual dangers of the mountains and the jungles are augmented by monsters migrating south from the Mana Wastes, or dragging themselves out of Draxmere, as well as monsters from the Axanir River to the south.

Vargas Swamp is the largest swamp in the predominantly dry country of Katapesh, spanning almost 30 miles in length and half that in width. Located in north-central Katapesh, myriad trees, herbs, and grasses grow there, attracting herbivores and their predators. A small tribe of lizardfolk makes its home here as well.

Vargas Swamp also contains numerous ruins and the skeletons of old villages (such as Slither Cove), that were swallowed by the rising water levels, which can fluctuate unpredictably. Some blame this strange occurrence on a green dragon said to live in the swamp, although this has never been proven.

The Varisian Council is one of the three governing bodies (along with the Office of the Lord-Mayor and the Council of Ushers) of the Varisian city of Magnimar. It was created to help address the needs and concerns of the city's Varisian people; it has little power in the city otherwise. It is headquartered among the colorful tents and wagons of Magnimar's Keystone neighborhood. As of 4712 AR, it was led by the elderly Remeria Callinova.
Vashnarstill Estate, located in The Greens district of Kintargo, Ravounel, is the home of House Vashnarstill.

The Vashnarstill Shipyard is a centuries-old fixture of the Yolubilis Harbor area of Kintargo. Named for House Vashnarstill, it has remained the most reliable dockyard for over 10 generations due to its management. Ownership is handed down on the basis of merit rather than blood ties; each owner has tried to select the best employee to succeed him, which has worked well so far.

Its owner as of 4724 AR was Kohl Draksitus. In 4715 AR, Draksitus' most significant concerns were the stiff competition from new yards in the rival Chelaxian cites of Westcrown and Corentyn. However, her more recent struggles are the result of keeping up with the demands of Sendi Vashnarstill, whose ambitions to make Kintargo a hub of trade with the distant continent of Arcadia are taxing the shipyard's capacity.
The Vault of Silver and Ice was a valuable mine in the Irriseni province of Bleakmarch, discovered during the reign of Queen Velikas.

The Ustalavic county of Barstoi boasts three Pharasmin monasteries: the Chapel of Guilts; the Mother of Skulls; and the Vault of Tears. The Vault of Tears lies in the far north-east of the county between the Babelwood and the West Sellen River near the border of Ustalav with Numeria.
The Vault of the Forgotten Prophet is a vault hidden under the plains of Rhuzam that can only be accessed by using teleportation magic.

No one is entirely sure what is inside the Vault of the Imposter Goblin. A few even doubt its existence, though it certainly does. The vault has one large stone entryway that connects to a larger underground complex.

The Yolubilis River begins high on the slopes of Mount Spire, just below the tree line, as a trickle that turns into a series of waterfalls. These waterfalls gather multiple streams as they surge downward, and the tallest, called the Veil of the Spire, falls more than 300 feet into a large pool that is the river's highest navigable point. Behind the waterfalls is an extensive networks of caves, some of which contain their own streams and falls. Many of these caves are riddled with cave fishers, chardas, and other monsters. In addition, several tribes of goblins and kobolds compete for a living in these caverns.
Located half way between the Cyphergate and Maskyr's Island, the Velashu Ferry is run by Grimas Oltedler.

Velecia Nora is an isolated snow-covered fort made of iron and stone in the Irriseni province known as the Verge. When a unit of soldiers demonstrates cowardice or disobedience, it is marched to Velecia Nora where it receives what is known as the Velecian Cruelty. One soldier in each group of ten is selected in random and beaten to the death by his nine comrades. The remaining soldiers form the new unit and return to duty. Necromancers raise the corpses of the killed soldiers and add them to the ranks of the Decimated, a small army of undead soldiers that drill eternally in the wastes southeast of Velecia Nora. The Decimated brigade is led by the graveknight General Fyodor Yelizaveta.

Versade Villa is the headquarters of House Versade, one of the aristocratic families of the Varisian city of Magnimar best known for throwing amazing parties. It is located at the end of a long line of upper-class villas in the Alabaster District, directly beside Valdemar Villa.

As of 4724 AR, Vespam Artisans is one of the larger businesses still in the Old Kintargo district of Kintargo. It serves as both a metalworking workshop and tinkers' guild. Vespam Artisans is owned and operated by Vespasio Vespam, a fifth-generation Kintargan and lifelong resident of Old Kintargo.

Vhunsaub is thought to be an ancient underwater treasury of the Ghol-Gan, and is located among the Cannibal Isles of the Shackles. Many have tried to explore the ruin, but none have progressed past the entrance guarded by a magically compelled sea serpent.

The Victocora Estate was burned down upon the seizure of Kintargo by House Thrune and its installed Lord Mayor, Barzillai Thrune, in the event now known as the Night of Ashes. The fire killed several members of House Victocora, and the manor ruins were never rebuilt. As of 4724 AR, the Silver Council of Kintargo and Rexus Victocora, the last surviving member, planned to convert the site to a memorial park for the Night of Ashes.

Vigil was not only a mighty fortress that drew warriors of good like a beacon, but also the capital of the country of Lastwall. It was a city of music, joy, and faith that came to a terrible end in the summer of 4719 AR when Tar-Baphon escaped from his centuries-long confinement and unleashed the destructive weapon known as the Radiant Fire upon the city, destroying it completely. Its ruined remains now mar the Gravelands.

Vigil's Hope, located in the Precipice Quarter of Absalom, is the headquarters of the Knights of Lastwall and serves as an embassy for the exiled leadership of the destroyed nation of Lastwall. Watcher-Lord Ulthun II resides in Vigil's Hope, from which he coordinates the organization's diplomatic and fundraising activities.

Viperwall is a notorious keep built on the eastern shores of Ember Lake in central Varisia. Its many conical towers and serpent carvings emit a sickening green light and poisonous fumes, so it is to no surprise that the place is greatly avoided by the local population.

Rumors suggest that the castle was built in the mid-fifth millennium AR by serpentfolk who traveled up from Sekamina through the Mobhad Leigh in order to create a surface outpost for their people. Others believe that the fortress has existed since the time of Thassilon. Deep within the keep is a portal to the ruins of Sverenagati.

The Viridian Forge is a smithy made of basalt blocks that uses Netherworld fire to forge weapons. The blacksmith here is Ukorviak, a shadow giant and the only one among the Xoskerik tribe who knows the secrets of forging living steel. Weapon sales are usually reserved for agents of the Umbral Court, though Ukorviak sometimes decides to sell to foreigners, provided they pay the exorbitant prices he demands.

The Viridian Nexus is a grotto within the Verduran Forest. Corazal, a very old conrasu, took root in the area, creating the grotto to maintain the forest's balance. Several buildings made from Corazal's wood serve as shelters for their attendants.

Corazal can share their knowledge with those they deems worthy by showing a repository of events that occurred in the forest.

Viritash's Tail is an unholy valley within the section of the Pardaparbat Mountains inside the Narhari Desert. It is named after the evil Vudran dragon deity Viritash, and a scepter of incredible potency made from Viritash's severed tail remains at the heart of the valleys. The land surrounding Viritash's Tail is filled with numerous linnorms and other corrupt dragons fighting to claim the scepter for themselves.
The Voghul Caverns are winding warrens beneath the center of the Chitterwood in Isger.

The Voinum Estate is located about three miles outside of the village of Voinaris, at the heart of the Voinum Barony in Taldor's Tandak Prefecture. It serves as the ancestral seat of the vaunted House Voinum.

The estate features one of the most extensive wine cellars in northern Taldor, including centuries-old bottles, and the rest of the estate houses secret rooms containing rare recipes and yeast for winemaking drawn from across Avistan.

High in Volfast's Tower stands the undead Volfast Raven-Banner, cursed to forever remain at his post after he drunkenly boasted to Queen Sascha that, if not for his limited mortal life, he would eternally hold back the Frozen Fog itself in the queen's name. Unfortunately for him, she granted his request, and transformed him into his current state. Here he remains until someone can defeat him in single combat. Some say that whoever defeats him would not only free him, but also inherit his cursed post, while others say they would gain a great, hidden wealth somewhere in the tower.

Vonosh was founded in 3314 AR after the Winter War to serve as the provincial capital of Hoarwood. In 3444 AR, Queen Morgannan razed the city to the ground in a storm of fire and ice and executed all residents of Vonosh—regardless of guilt or innocence—for their part in a plot to overthrow her and in retribution for the death of her daughter.

Following the Hoarwood Rebellion in 3445 AR, the Heralds of Summer's Return tried to use the ruins of Vonosh as a base for guerrilla strikes against the new provincial capital city of Hoarwood. The plan failed because of the angry, restless spirits of those who had been executed by the queen. Some of the Heralds did not escape the attack of the spirits inhabiting the ruins.
The Wailing Cave is a half-submerged cavern in the Pangalley Atoll which is avoided by the pirates of the isle, who claim the ghost of murdered Black-Eye Benbem haunts it.

The Walking Man is a 30-foot-tall tree-like construct sculpted to resemble a human man. It consists of at least four different trees bound together with ivy and other vines and covered in herbs and flowers. The flowers include amaranth, bluebell, buttercup, celandine, clover, creeping bellflower, daffodil, dragon's teeth, eyebright, goldenrod, hawksbeard, hyacinth, iris, knotweed, lily, mouse-ear, mudwort, nightshade, orchid, shepherd's purse, and tansy. It was most likely created by elves, but no one remembers when or how it was made.

Many have climbed inside of the construct's hulking body through an entrance in its shoulder and written notes. One such note, from Variel Morgethai, states that the burial mound Erithiel's Hall may somehow be connected to The Walking Man. In this room are panels that can act as controls for the construct, which were tested by Varian Jeggare. On midsummer each year, it takes one step towards Erages.

The Wandering Spheres is a massive ruined orrery located in central Kyonin with human-sized planetary spheres that once must have risen above the treetops. Its mechanism shattered long ago, and the many models of celestial objects now lie scattered about the glade, or are attached to metal beams that are twisted. No one knows how the orrery was destroyed, but what is stranger is that it models a solar system that is not that of Golarion.

The War Cage is a weapons and armor shop located in the Yolubilis Harbor district of Kintargo that is a favourite amongst adventurers. It is named for its arena-like structure, with a central sparring area where customers can try out any of the weapons for sale, including a frost lucerne hammer that is claimed to be from distant Irrisen.

As of 4724 AR the War Cage was run by Chuko 'Sharp Beak and Hooks', a tengu ex-adventurer who offers discounts to other adventurers but also possesses a well-known hatred of thieves. He is equally renowned for telling stories to his customers and name-dropping his friend Shensen, the famed opera diva and Silver Raven.

Washers' Row is a group of businesses that controls large-volume laundry services in Magnimar. Based in the Beacon's Point district, it is actually a front for the Sczarni run by Mother Flytongue. Her organization, the Washside Wringers, are actually interested in smuggling. The entire area reeks of chemicals and soaps used for everything from clothing to ship sails.

The Water Gardens of Xerbystes were commissioned by Xerbystes I, the first Qadiran satrap of Osirion in the 16th century AR. Feeling that the delta of the River Sphinx was underutilized, the satrap ordered a complex of gardens and pools to be built on an island, and had it shored up against flooding. The new Keleshite elite frequented the garden, but it was avoided by the Osirians, who felt that the attempt to hold back the river was disrespectful to the water spirits. The river reclaimed the island in the great flood of 1535 AR, killing everyone who was there, and it has never been reoccupied. The island occasionally reemerges, leaving parts of the Gardens high and dry, but they are soon submerged in the Sphinx's floods again.

Wedding rock is a ruined ancient Azlanti altar on the island of Nal-Kashel, in the Hellmouth Gulf west of Cheliax. Residents of Blackcove, a village on the gulf's coast, traditionally consummate their marriage vows on the altar.

The Weeping Fields were once a plain with a verdant meadow, but after Earthfall, shadows filled the area and drained the vegetation of its color. It was here that the Black Triune met with Zon-Kuthon and signed the agreement that sealed the fate of all Nidal. Now, the Weeping Fields form the entry point to the Umbral Basin.

There are some vestiges of civilization on the plain, but shadowy predators and the soil that hinders agriculture make life difficult for the few who choose to live there. The Nidalese army, the Adamant Guard, makes more use of the plain, conducting military exercises and training recruits. At the end of their training, and after a grueling trial, successful recruits are able to join the Adamant Guard, where they earn the respect and fear of the rest of Nidal's inhabitants.
The Weeping Grandfather is a volcanic peak in the Kortos Mounts on the Isle of Kortos. It is best known as the location for the Cave of Zero Incantation, a now abandoned site sacred to the Muted God.

The Weeping Stairwell is a hidden series of caverns on the eastern coast that provide access to the isolated upper reaches of the secret island of Grand Sarret.

The Weeping Stairwell can be accessed from the waters of the Obari Ocean via a cave that lies concealed below the waterline along the eastern reaches of Grand Sarret. The Weeping Stairwell can also be accessed from the island's top via a narrow fissure hidden within the dense foliage of Grand Sarret. The Weeping Caverns gained their name as a small stream cascades down the through the caverns making the climb up from the ocean even more treacherous. To make matters worse for any trying to traverse the Weeping Stairwell, the masters of the Conservatory, the Jalmeri training school for spies that sits atop Grand Sarret, are well aware of the Stairwell's existence. As such they have placed a pair of faydhaan to guard the Weeping Stairwell to prevent intruders from accessing the island.

The so-called Well of Lies is a dungeon in the west of Nex. It is situated in a rift near the foothills of the Shattered Range. It is believed the complex was built by the cyclopes, who called it Golanoth, in an ancient age before the fall of the Starstone.

The archmage Nex and his adventuring companions found clues to the dungeon's location amongst the ancient ruins of the Mwangi Expanse, and eventually located and explored the complex. It is believed that what Nex found there, contributed a great deal to his eventual rise to power.

There are strange scrying pools in the depths of the caverns, which purported to guide Nex in his search for eternal glory. It was the pools' whispering which convinced Nex to establish in the region the kingdom which bears his name. However, following their advice seemed to result in worse and worse outcomes, and eventually they came to be known as the Well of Lies.

The dungeon was sealed up on the orders of Nex. However, Nex disappeared a long time ago, and the Council of Three and Nine are lax in enforcing this edict. A few bold adventurers have been able to enter the dungeon in search of the pools' dangerous advice.

Many of the mysterious Passages of Nex, who resemble Nex's deceased victims, migrate from the Well of Lies and across the nation of Nex claiming to speak on Nex's behalf.

The Well of Sorrows is an ornately decorated shaft within the Wizard-King's Pit, a massive dungeon complex built by Tar-Baphon sometime before 896 AR on the Isle of Terror in Lake Encarthan. Originally designed to trap the god Aroden, the Well was never used and is thought to still be active. Decorated with murals and images of mortality and defeat, it is said to run from the surface all the way to the Darklands realm of Sekamina.

The Wellspring Tower is one of the aeon towers that Aroden placed around the Isle of Kortos. The tower is a 300-foot-tall mudbrick step pyramid with a flat 10-foot-wide top and four uneven tiers.

The tower is located on the north side of the Isle of Kortos, near the Verdant Passage and the small town of Matten Cleave. It is known for having a sweet water spring at its base that provides water and greenery to the surrounding area.
The Whale is one of the ten remaining pilings of the Irespan in Magnimar. It stands 170 feet high. There are no known entrances into the piling.

The Whirlpool Rush is a seaside cataract at the Nalt's Island in the Shackles. It is located on the eastern end of the straits between Redbow Isle and Nalt's Island. Two sibling charybdises are said to be the cause of the perpetual vortex beneath the cataract. Sailors trying to avoid the hostile sedacthy-plagued waters of Shark Island, dare the straits between Redbow Isle and Nalt's Island and often meet their doom beneath the crashing waves of the whirlpool.

Whisperfall Pass is the largest and most well-known pass through the southern Tusk Mountains, connecting the Hold of Belkzen to the Ustalavic county of Canterwall. Because of the Belkzen orcs' love of raiding human lands, it is also one of the most contested areas in the country, with the Skull Eater tribe controlling its eastern slopes while the Blood Trail tribe dominates in the west.

White Canyon is not a single passage but a network of branching gulfs whose walls narrow overhead. Kholo live in hide tents in the most sheltered areas, or dig burrows at the base of the canyon walls. Rath Sandstalker conducts frequent raids on caravans and small settlements, seeking healthy humanoids to sell at the Fleshfairs. The warriors of Fort Longjaw attempt an attack from time to time.

The White Canyon tribe is the second-largest kholo hold in Katapesh.

Despite the lingering fear many people have of the monstrous population here, kholo have not been a unified threat since the Siege of Solku, when the tribe assailed the city of Solku. Even so persistent rumours speak of Noor, the Red Sultana, who is said to be attempting to gather the kholo under her banner for another assault on the city, and then beyond.

The White Pass is the widest pass through the northern Zho Mountains, and is located in Qadira on its border with Taldor. It forms the western extent of the Golden Path before its terminus at Katheer.

The Battle of Urfa, the first armed conflict between Taldor and Qadira, took place in -4 AR near the White Pass.

Whitebridge Station was an outpost of the Aspis Consortium on the Vanji River in the Mwangi Expanse. It was located roughly 200 miles upriver from the town of Bloodcove, and was a 200-foot-long fortified wooden bridge across the river with numerous wooden structures built upon it. The Consortium allowed others to use the bridge to cross the river in return for a small toll payment.

The Consortium was breeding the magical fungus known as arcophage here.

Whitegate Market is located close to the centre of the aristocratic district known as The Greens in Kintargo. It is the city's most affluent market, and the streets surrounding it are filled with wealthy smiths of platinum, gold, and silver.

Whitespectre Canyon is a box canyon in the Nesmian Plains of Nirmathas. Numerous predators have claimed the canyon for themselves. As of 4717 AR it was plagued by Witchpelt, a giant smilodon that escaped from a traveling Varisian circus.

Willowmourn is the estate of the ruling family of the Ustalavic county of Amaans, the Galdanas, and can be found on the western border of Lake Kavapesta. A sprawling possession, it contains topiary gardens, hedge mazes, a bountiful garden, not to mention a well-built and secure manor house. Rumors of wild debauchery there have persisted for a long time, although recently the gossip has taken a decidedly more sinister tone. Now gossips whisper of fearful hauntings and murder most foul.

The Wilting Rose was a conservatory dedicated to the goddess Shelyn located on the outskirts of the Verduran Forest that has now fallen into serene ruin. Before its decline, the campus was known as Everrose School and was where young Taldans learned the art of sculpture and painting to a standard that matched the famed Rhapsodic College of Oppara. It has since become a mostly abandoned haven of werecreatures and hags.

Windsong Abbey is a pacifist refuge for followers of all religions—good and evil—to come and resolve their doctrinal and political differences in a non-violent manner and to peacefully further their own goals.
Windwatch Keep is a castle in the Mindspin Mountains near Molthune's western border with Nidal. It is the home of the Windwatchers, a sect of seers devoted to the god Gozreh.

Wingless Rock is a small, sparsely vegetated island off the west coast of Nidal. Local fishermen avoid it because there's nothing to catch there, and there are also strong superstitions about bad luck. The Aspis Consortium used the island for smuggling artifacts from Nidal, but the operation was shut down by the Pathfinder Society.

What few people know is that beneath the island lie laboratories dedicated to Conference Z research.
Owned by a former member of the Umbral Court, the Winter Garden is a cottage in the western Uskwood whose land around it is haunted by disorienting mists and unending snowfall.

The Winter Grove is an ancient druid's grove that lies within the Barrowood in Cheliax. Ruined and blackened, the grove predates the old empire of Taldor, before the rise of Cheliax as an independent nation.

Rumours say that within the grove lies a summoning circle of ancient origin, and that within this circle Abrogail I made her dark dealings with Asmodeus. In recent times, locals to the region have witnessed members of the royal family making regular (but secretive) visits to the site, always bringing sacrificial victims with them.

Wirholt's Rictus is a farm near the Mindspin Mountains primarily dedicated to cultivating crops that can be processed into medicine and drugs. The farm sells its products to the Nidalese, though some foreign clients seeking to experience drug-induced pain also place orders. The owner is Temarra, a devoted follower of Zon-Kuthon, who punishes her employees to keep them docile.

Beneath the farm are laboratories used by the Korholm Agenda to further their research.

Wisher's Well is one of the lesser known Thassilonian ruins in the greater Sandpoint area. This circular stone tower is 30 feet high, and the interior drops away into a 100-foot-deep shaft, ending in an underwater cavern connected to Sog's Bay.

This submerged complex was formerly the laboratory of Mazmiranna, who later abandoned it when she became the fifth runelord of greed. It has since been taken over by the albino alghollthu master Vorimorath, who has been drawn to Wisher's Well by the promise of Thassilonian treasures and the alghollthu master has restored Mazmiranna's wards and guardians. Myriad monsters also dwell in the complex, including Vorimorath's ulat-kini and faceless stalker minions, the latter of which have been modified to be able to breathe water.

The Witchbole is a giant, twisted thorn tree which Treerazer uses as a fortress and palace. As if its appearance were not harrowing enough, the bloated, gnarled tree is completely mobile, crawling slowly through the forest on its writhing roots. The Witchbole's true nature remains a mystery, though the arboreal regents of the Fierani Forest avoid the topic, leading some to believe that the massive demonic arbor was one of their kind before being corrupted to Treerazer's evil will.

The shattered crest of the Witchbole sometimes twists into the outline of a face, although this visage is vague. On its branches are the impaled corpses of those elves who sought to confront Treerazer directly.

The Witchcaves are a series of deep caverns in the south eastern region of Irrisen's Hoarwood province. According to legend, great power lies in these caves, which are also suspected of having an entrance to the Darklands.

In 3937 AR the survivors of the failed Harcatha Rebellion fled to the caves in the hope of recruiting Darklands allies to help their cause. Nothing more was heard of them until 4079 AR, when an insane force of Jadwiga emerged from the caves and rampaged across the region until they were wiped out by Irriseni forces led by General Chernim Karina.

Queen Karina, Irrisen's then ruler, ordered the caves sealed. However, a few adventurers recently defied the ban and investigated the caves—and found them overrun by qlippoth. The leader of these fiends is an augnagar called Ulkrostaz. Some of the Harcartha who entered the caves still live, serving as breeding stock and subject to ongoing torture.
Witchlight was a small settlement on the island of Devil's Elbow southwest of Riddleport. Founded by Yaris Neraken in 4680 AR, it was located on the island's highest point.
Witchlight Vale is a crater in western Numeria formed by an explosion that occurred nearly 7,000 years ago.

Withershin is a stretch of prairie in the Nesmian Plains of Nirmathas, characterized by several artificial earthen mounds. There are no established histories of the creators of these mounds, though the obvious candidates are either fey creatures or the Kellid tribes that lived in the area before Taldan colonization. The most prominent inhabitants of Withershin are a tribe of druidic centaurs, called the Withershins. Other traveling centaur tribes go out of their way to visit this tribe to pay tribute.

The Wolfhead inn, located in Andoran's Darkmoon Vale on a crumbling hillside west of the River Foam and the Wolfrun Hills, is so named for its design as a wolf's head with its mouth opening over a 50-foot drop into a patch of wolfsbane. The inn has nine rooms and a boarding capacity of 17.

Built in 4213 AR by the eccentric gnome architect Las Stopbiddle, the inn has been owned and passed down for generations. As of 4708 AR, its owner was the halfling Dopp, who employs guards but welcomes anyone to the inn as patrons.

Wolfpoint is the name of an Isgeri fort located north of the Chitterwood on the Conerica River, about 25 miles southwest of the town of Saringallow. It houses approximately 300 soldiers and their officers, many of whom are veterans of the recent Goblinblood Wars. The fort itself consists of several wooden barracks surrounded by a tall log palisade. Much of the palisade was destroyed during the wars and has since been rebuilt, although many sections still show signs of fire damage and goblin blood.

Wormwood Hall is located deep within the Lurkwood of north-western Varisia, near the forest's border with the Red Mountains. A large manor house overrun by chocking vines, no being has set foot within the hall in living memory. Strange, twisting runes cover its doors and walls, and it is generally assumed that Wormwood is tied to the Lurkwood's strange seasons.

Wreath of Stars is a circle of standing stones near Backar Forest believed to be dedicated to Desna due to the astronomical maps carved into the stone. In reality, the standing stones were used by fey when the connection to the First World was strongest in the area. A fey prince named Allarik built an underground dungeon connecting the entrance to the circle on the surface. When Earthfall occurred, most of the dungeon's residents perished, except for an ankou named Edani, who kills all who enter the dungeon. His reputation spread, and a cabal of cultists camped near the standing stones, considering him a harbinger of destruction.

The Brine Demon was the ship of the Free Captain Avret Kinkarian. Kinkarian and the Brine Demon menaced Desperation Bay and the southeastern Arcadian Ocean, and were part of a scheme to extort the government of Sargava. The ship crashed into a cliffside of Smuggler's Shiv at some point prior to 4710 AR.

The Jenivere was a Wyvern-class Sargavan merchant vessel that plied the waters of the Arcadian Ocean, making the 100 day, 3,400 mile-long run between its home port of Eleder and the Varisian city of Magnimar. Resupply and trading stops along the way included the cities of Senghor, Bloodcove (Mwangi Expanse), Port Peril, Quent, Ollo (The Shackles), Ilizmagorti (Mediogalti Island), Corentyn, Pezzack, Kintargo (Cheliax), and Magnimar.

The Nightvoice was a ship of exploration in the employ of the Pathfinder Society, with a home port of Almas, Andoran. The ship went missing while returning from a voyage to the coast of southern Garund decades prior to 4710 AR. Its true fate was unknown to most: it had crashed between a pair of rocks off the shore of Silent Island, a small island off the coast of Smuggler's Shiv in Desperation Bay, decades prior to 4710 AR.

Wyo's Rest is a small Qadiran island located off the Alavah Peninsula, nestled in the waters between Sedeq and the Meraz Desert.

Wyo's Rest is named after Lady Wyo, a powerful siren who rules the island. Lady Wyo is accompanied by a harem of male suitors provided by the city of Sedeq who all spend four years living a life of indentured luxury. In exchange, Lady Wyo guards the island and allows Qadiran ships to pass, even helping any vessels in distress.

The island is covered in both verdant plant life and elaborately designed architecture.

Both a functioning lighthouse and a tribute to Magnimar's founder Alcaydian Indros the Wyrmwatch, or Wyrmwatch Tower, is a one of the city's most prominent landmarks. The Wyrmwatch sits at the western most edge of Outcast's Cove at the very tip of Beacon's Point jutting out into the Varisian Gulf warning ships away from the dangerous spur of rock and welcomes them to the busy harbour of the Dockway and the Bazaar of Sails.

It supposedly sits upon the very site where Alcaydian Indros slew the mighty Sea Dragon known as Vydrarch which was one of the events that lead to the founding of Magnimar.
Xefon-Ra is a mountain in the desert of northern Osirion. It is located between the Glazen Sheets and the Sahure Wastes.
Xerysis Manor, located in The Greens district of Kintargo, Ravounel, is the home of Ivran Xerysis.

The island-city of Xin, also known as the Isle of Xin, was the capital of Thassilon during the reign of its namesake, Emperor Xin. It sank to the Arcadian Ocean's floor after Earthfall in -5293 AR but rose from the depths in 4712 AR off the coast of modern-day Varisia.

Xin-Bakrakhan was the capital of the ancient Thassilonian Realm of Wrath, Bakrakhan. Most of it was destroyed during Earthfall and sank beneath the waters of the Varisian Gulf. What little remains intact can be found on Rivenrake Island, surrounding the honeycombed massif called Hollow Mountain.

Xin-Gastash was the capital of the Thassilonian Realm of Gluttony, and was destroyed by the great event that brought down the rest of the kingdom: Earthfall. Constructed underground so that the necromancers of Gastash could practice their arts without the detrimental interference of the sun, Xin-Gastash was said to have contained Thassilon's greatest bathhouses, drug dens, and feast halls. Though much of the city was destroyed and sealed off from outside contact by the earthquakes that shook Golarion following Earthfall, an obstructed entrance to Xin-Gastash exists beneath the mountain the orcs of Belkzen call the Sleeper.
Xin-Grafar, the City of Golden Death, is the lost underground treasure city of Tar-Baphon, the Whispering Tyrant, located on the Isle of Terror.

Xopatl Mountain is located at the centre of the Arcadian nation of Xopatl and is all that remains of the mountains that once covered the entire nation. Xopatl was formed after a massive fragment of the Aeon Star struck Arcadia in the Mildanesi Mountains at the start of the Age of Darkness. The hero-gods of Xopatl found this shard and, after throwing off the yoke of the Razatlan Empire, destroyed the mountains to create the area that is modern Xopatl. Xopatl Mountain is the sole remaining mountain, left looming in place at the nation's centre.

Xopatl Mountain is a massive volcano, but the hero-gods enchanted it so that it would never erupt unless given a specific command, the idea being that the hero-gods could use this should Xopatl ever completely fall to invaders. Xopatl Mountain now has 10,000 years of magma built up below it, and none left alive know what the magical command is that would cause Xopatl Mountain to erupt.

Yahuima's Spring is a geyser located in the east of Xopatl, near to the Mildanesi Mountains that form much of the nation's border. It is said that Yahuima's Spring was created when the hero-god Yahuima wept after her lover, a fellow hero-god, ascended to true divinity and her tears created this geyser. To this day, Yahuima's Spring is infused with divine energy and, whenever it erupts, its water causes nearby plants to bloom with miraculous speed. This miracle normally draws visitors when the geyser is most active during the winter season, however recently these eruptions have instead spread a wave of destruction, blighting plants and corrupting animals.

Yan Ulvedro's Fort was built in the earliest days of the nation of Xopatl by the Arcadian hero-god Ulvedro to help defend the nation against its enemies. Located high in the Mildanesi Mountains, Yan Ulvedro's Fort was designed to protect Xopatl from the neighbouring Razatlan Empire and assisted on the few occasions when Xopatl was attacked. As the power of Razatlan waned, Yan Ulvedro's Fort gradually became more akin to a monastery, and pilgrims from both Xopatl and neighbouring Innazpa now visit the sages of Yan Ulvedro's Fort to seek wisdom and learn their unique mystical techniques. These sages can help travellers reach enlightenment by temporarily pulling their soul out of their body.

Ygrath's Pier is one of the cyclopean monuments of ancient Thassilon, built with the labor of enslaved rune and stone giants. It is located in the western edge of the Inner Sea, which was the southwestern-most point of the Thassilonian nation of Eurythnia.

Yllaldo Castle is a keep built atop a maze of tunnels in southern Xopatl. It is named for the legendary Arcadian hero-god Yllaldo the Manifester, who lived out the last of his years diligently guarding the keep until the end of the Age of Darkness.

Zar Kragnaral is located in the Stormspear Mountains in the Lands of the Linnorm Kings. The legendary black basalt and blue ice fortress is ruled by the so-called Deathless Jarl.

Zar Kragnaral is an imposing structure nearly seven hundred feet in height. Its windows are made of hard ice and its towers are built of black rock. Delicate bridges of ice connect its black towers. The fortress looms atop a low plateau deep in the mountains. The view from its highest towers affords a panorama of the northern Thanelands and Hagreach.

Zhobl is a volcano located in the eastern Zho Mountains of Qadira. The eruptions of Zhobl and its companion Zhonar covered the nearby town of Shadun in ash and dust, forcing its inhabitants to abandon it.

Zhonar is a volcano located in the eastern Zho Mountains of Qadira. The eruptions of Zhonar and its companion Zhobl covered the nearby town of Shadun in ash and dust, forcing its inhabitants to abandon it.

Zhukuo Tegeg is the communal cemetery of the town of Ngozu on the Mgange Cove island of the Shackles. As of 4712 AR, several juju zombies had recently emerged from the eerie cemetery. Chief wendifa Ajuoga Baas put down many of these undead monsters but sought aid from outsiders to end the zombie menace. Some of Ajuoga's followers thus began to doubt her worthiness as chief wendifa.

Zincher's Arena, also known as Zincher Arena, is a massive stone arena that dominates the Wharf District of Riddleport. It holds brutal contests of strength and combat prowess between slaves, criminals, gladiators, and captured wild creatures. The arena also sometimes holds formal duels between members of Riddleport's elite. Since at least 4708 AR and as of approximately 4718 AR, crimelord Clegg Zincher ran the arena, although his financial collapse after attempting to exploit a fallen star on the nearby isle of Devil's Elbow in 4708 AR eventually led to his being forced to auction the arena in 4718 AR.

The Zolurket Mines, once called Tar-Urkatha, are played-out platinum mines. Zolurket is a Kelish word for "Dark Death".

Zolurket remains abandoned for two reasons: the lack of worthwhile ores and minerals, and the presence of undead predators. The types of undead that lurk in the mines are unknown. There are rumors that Zolurket was abandoned before its wealth was depleted, and a mining company based in the city of Katapesh is attempting to reopen them.

Zunderwal Hold is a long-fallen dwarven fortress in the Stained Peaks near Avistan's approach to the Crown of the World. It has long been occupied by bugbears, who fight an ongoing battle for supremacy over who should hold the title of "Huntmaster of the Hold".

Zura's Mouth is a series of springs and pools in the Kaava Lands and the source of the slow and broad Oubinga River which meanders through the jungles of the southwestern Mwangi Expanse before emptying into Desperation Bay. A number of tribes worship the place and use the pools for ritual sacrifice by drowning. The bodies don't last long, as the Oubinga's upper reaches are home to crimson maka-yika, a schooling, carnivorous fish similar to piranhas.
